content.question: A uniform meterstick is balanced at the center, as shown above. Which of the following shows how a 0.50 kg mass and a 1.0 kg mass could be hung on the meterstick so that the stick stays balanced?

choices.label: A diagram shows a uniform meter stick balanced at the center. The meter stick has five points marked to the left and right from its center. A mass of 0.5 k g is hung on the fifth point on the left and a mass of 1 k g is hung on the fifth point on the right.
A diagram shows a uniform meter stick balanced at the center. A mass of 0.5 k g is hung on the fourth point on the left and a mass of 1 k g is hung on the second point on the right.
A diagram shows a uniform meter stick balanced at the center. A mass of 0.5 k g is hung on the third point to the left and a mass of 1 k g is hung on the second point to the right.
A diagram shows a uniform meter stick balanced at the center. A mass of 0.5 k g is hung on the second point on the left and a mass of 1 k g is hung on the fourth point on the right.
A diagram shows a uniform meter stick balanced at the center. A mass of 0.5 k g is hung on the first point on the left and a mass of 1 k g is hung on the second point on the right.

content.answer: A diagram shows a uniform meter stick balanced at the center. A mass of 0.5 k g is hung on the fourth point on the left and a mass of 1 k g is hung on the second point on the right.
